CitaviR 0.2.0

Identify obvious duplicates based on title and year

Source: R/find_obvious_dups.R
find_obvious_dups.Rd

Currently this only works for files that were generated while Citavi was set to "English" so that column names are "Short Title" etc.

find_obvious_dups(CitDat, dupInfoAfterID = TRUE, preferDupsWithPDF = TRUE)

Arguments

CitDat

A dataframe/tibble returned by read_Citavi_xlsx. The following columns must be present: ID, Title, Year.
dupInfoAfterID

If TRUE (default), the newly created columns clean_title, clean_title_id, has_obv_dup and obv_dup_id are moved right next to the ID column.
preferDupsWithPDF

If TRUE (default), obvious duplicates are sorted by their info in columns has_attachment and/or Locations (given they are present in the dataset). After sorting, duplicates with the most occurences of ".pdf" in Locations and a TRUE in has_attachment are first and will thus be chosen as dup_01.

Value

A tibble containing three additional columns: clean_title_id, has_obv_dup and obv_dup_id.

Examples

path <- example_xlsx("3dupsin5refs.xlsx")
read_Citavi_xlsx(path) %>%
   find_obvious_dups()

#> # A tibble: 5 x 23
#>   ID     clean_title  clean_title_id has_obv_dup obv_dup_id `Short title`  Title
#>   <chr>  <chr>        <chr>          <lgl>       <chr>      <chr>          <chr>
#> 1 7e04d~ estimating_~ ct_01          FALSE       dup_01     Schmidt, Hart~ Esti~
#> 2 2481c~ heritabilit~ ct_02          TRUE        dup_01     Schmidt, Hart~ Heri~
#> 3 db3ab~ heritabilit~ ct_02          TRUE        dup_02     Schmidt, Hart~ Heri~
#> 4 ba575~ hritability~ ct_03          FALSE       dup_01     Schmidt, Hart~ Hrit~
#> 5 fa402~ more_larger~ ct_04          FALSE       dup_01     Schmidt, Möhr~ More~
#> # ... with 16 more variables: Year <chr>, Author <chr>, Categories <chr>,
#> #   Groups <chr>, Abstract <chr>, DOI name <chr>, PubMed ID <chr>,
#> #   Online address <chr>, Periodical <chr>, Volume <chr>, Number <chr>,
#> #   Page range <chr>, Locations <chr>, has_attachment <lgl>, red_flag <lgl>,
#> #   blue_circle <lgl>
